MajorClaims.MC1: media is overemphasizing the personal lives of famous people in this modern society
MajorClaims.MC2: disadvantages of overemphasizing on personal lives of famous people by media outweigh its advantages
MajorClaims.MC3: paying too much attention on personal lives of famous people may be a serious problem

Claims.C1: media provide information about an event that recently occurred somewhere and which is important to the people
Claims.C2: sensationalism distract the viewers from public or social problems
Claims.C3: gossip involves misleading images for the purpose of boosting newspaper sales or exciting public opinion

Premises.P1: The most important of all is that the essence of coverage accurate and not based on gossip
Premises.P3: Some reporters are more interested with gossip than news relating to public issues, paying too much attention to the personal lives of famous people
Premises.P4: these personal reports of famous people, unimportant information or distorted stories, will not solve problem related with the society
Premises.P5: yellow journalism block the viewers from significant news, such as education, environment and public issues
Premises.P6: The media face the challenge that media executives must choose the content, which can attract the audience
Premises.P7: The audience may see a lot of photos in the kind of reports, which seems to tell a story
Premises.P8: it is unfair that the ridiculous coverage may be a vexation for the famous people who are reported
